summary: If you're not pleased with the original Proudspire Manor, this mod could help you out. It aims to make the manor more useful and a little bit nicer, without getting too oversized or over-the-top.
descriptionHtml:
[center][img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/39eqeip115bijmb/PMR_Headline_PMR.png?dl=0[/img][/center]
[center][img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/9ul9ixwtj7ptfnx/PMR_Headline_Screenshots.png?dl=0[/img][/center]


[img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/nfvzkoymsk5kk0t/PMR_Headline_Description.png?dl=0[/img]
This mod aims to make Proudspire Manor more useful and a little bit nicer, without getting too oversized or over the top.
The mod also fixes some bugs, like clipping textures, wrong key assigned to the 3rd housedoor, doubled up chairs,
remaining cobwebs and maybe some other. The changes to Proudspire Manor in detail:

[size=3][b][u]Lower floor[/u][/b][/size]
Alchemy lab and enchanting table are now located in one room, right when you enter the house through the lower
door. Also there's a stand for the dragonpriest masks and dragon claws, it can be purchased from Falk Firebeard.

The former room for the housecarl was turned into a complete smithy with anvil, smelter, tanning rack, grinding wheel,
workbench, wood chopping block, weapon rack and a mannequin.

Enlarged trophy room, it now has 4 mannequins, 3 large display cases, 4 small display cases, 9 weapon plaques
and a weapon rack.

[size=3][b][u]Middle floor[/u][/b][/size]
A new room for the housecarl was added next to the kitchen. Jordis will sleep there from 0:00 to 6:00 am.
Remember that the room only gets furnished, if you actually become thane of Solitude.

At the other side of the kitchen, a small room to store food and other things was added.

Small guestroom, it can be purchased as a new upgrade from the steward of Solitude.

2 bookshelves and 3 planters were added to the living room.

[size=3][b][u]Upper floor[/u][/b][/size]
The player's room was enlarged as well, it now contains 4 big bookshelves, shield racks, a weapon rack, 2 mannequins,
a small display case and plenty of storage room for your goods.

[i]Hearthfire version: With the optional file 'PMR - Multiple Adoptions Support', the children's room and dining table can be enlarged to
allow up to 6 children living in Proudspire Manor. It's meant to be used in conjunction with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/29249/?]Hearthfire multiple adoptions[/url] by TMPhoenix.[/i]

[b][size=3][u]General[/u][/size][/b]
Reworked the porch, nicer furniture and some more plants.

Added several paintings to the house.

New upgrades can be purchased from the steward of Solitude.



[img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/5q7845kivjigubv/PMR_Headline_BeforeInstall.png?dl=0[/img]
- Take all stuff you stored in the house, leave the house.
- Open console (~) and type: [i]resetinterior solitudeproudspiremanor[/i] [Enter].
- Make another save, then install.

[i]Hearthfire version: Before you install the mod, send any children living in Proudspire to another home.
Not doing so will keep the beds at their old location. Then make a save in any interior cell except
Proudspire Manor, install. After installation, send the children back.[/i]



[img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/gmy7zqio7njbc25/PMR_Headline_Installation.png?dl=0[/img]
- Extract the archive to your Skyrim installation folder or use a mod manager of your choice.
- Activate the plugin-file in 'Data Files' in the Skyrim launcher or in your mod manger.



[img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/utgockvve5a4k4e/PMR_Headline_Updating.png?dl=0[/img]
If you update from a version previous to 1.6, it's necessary to completely uninstall the mod.
This means to remove all your belongings from the house, then uninstall the mod and make
a save without the mod installed or activated.



[img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/mkkeuesxgbsfs1i/PMR_Headline_Deinstallation.png?dl=0[/img]
- Remove everything you stored in the house.
- Delete the files in your SkyrimData directory or uninstall with mod manager.

[i]Hearthfire version: After uninstalling, use console command
[color=#ffff99]resetinterior solitudeproudspiremanor[/color] to remove remaining plants.
[/i]


[img]https://dl.dropbox.com/s/mwujq4ff94fgi97/PMR_Headline_KnownIssues.png?dl=0[/img]
Placing too many torches inside the house can result in flickering/disappearing lights.

There may occur conflicts with other Mods, that make changes to Proudspire or the surrounding area.
In some cases, it will be solved by loading this Mod at last.

Using this mod along with Enhanced Lights FX will cause some incompatibility issues like floating candles, misplaced
walls and instable lights. These changes can be reverted by installing the No-homes Patch that comes with ELFX.

[color=#ffff99][i]Q: My spouse suddenly has this strange dialogue option. What is it for?[/i][/color]
A: If your spouse refuses to sleep in the players bed, you can use this option. It will add a sleep package to the spouse.
There's another dialogue option to remove the package, if it's necessary. The dialogue will only appear in Proudspire.

[color=#ffff99][i]Q: Is it possible to use the Non-Hearthfire version with Hearthfire DLC installed?[/i][/color]
A: In theory this is possible if you a) have already purchased all vanilla upgrades, except for the children's room,
and b) you don't intent to buy the children's room in the future.
